intro: Stellaria werchojanensis, commonly known as the Werchojan starwort, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments. Its flowers are star-shaped, with five petals, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
